results.title: The World's greatest freak show
results.creator_credit: Sam Weiss, Nick Bosustow, Xerox Films and Stephen Bosustow Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Desire to read”.
A cartoon adventure designed to develop reading skills by visualising book materials. Presents the story of a man who in his efforts to obtain riches, exploits freaks for theatrical purposes. Based on the picture book by Ellen Raskin. Teacher’s notes accompany the video.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Sam Weiss, Nick Bosustow, Xerox Films and Stephen Bosustow Productions

results.title: The Seventh mandarin (K)
results.creator_credit: Sam Weiss, Nick Bosustow and Stephen Bosustow Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Desire to read”.
Long ago in a walled palace lived a Chiense emperor, guarded and guided by seven assistants called mandarins. None of them ever set foot outside the palace and they knew nothing of the people until the seventh and youngest mandarin ventured out one night…Based on the picture book by Jane Yolen.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Sam Weiss, Nick Bosustow and Stephen Bosustow Productions

results.title: The Peasant's pea patch: a Russian folk tale
results.creator_credit: Nick Bosustow, Xerox Films and Stephen Bosustow Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Desire to read”.
This tall tale from Russian folklore follows the hilarious misadventures of a Russian peasant who tries in vain to protect his pea patch from a flock of hungry cranes. The film ends with the defeated peasant illustrating that, although life can be difficult, humanity somehow manages not only to survive but to survive in good spirit.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Nick Bosustow, Xerox Films and Stephen Bosustow Productions

results.title: Space
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “The Dance”.
Space is the dancer’s canvas. In this film, animation is used in addition to live action to give a picture of space both inside and outside the dancer’s body.

results.title: Motion
results.creator_credit: Murray Louis and Jack Lieb Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Dance as an art form”
Part of a series designed to introduce dance as an art form. Illustrates how commonplace actions can be sensed and then transformed through selection, arrangement and skillful performance. Narrated by Murray Louis.

results.title: Time
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “The Dance series”
For the dancer, time is the awareness of duration. The film moves from the traditional musical definition of time into other areas of the time sense.

results.title: Shape
results.creator_credit: Murray Louis and American Federation of Arts
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Dance”.
The sculptural dynamics of the dancer’s body is the focus of this film. The dancer is revealed as a sculptor who moulds and transforms himself into forms that lend their force to the eloquence of dance.

results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Dance”.
The body is the dancer’s instrument. The film examines the dancer’s instrument from its preparation in the studio to its use in the eventual performance experience
